result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda K. Valliere was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 2:15 PM Defendant Amanda K. Valliere appeared by video.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton appeared by video for Amanda K. Valliere. Defendant agrees to proceeded via zoom.  Waives right to appear in person. Plea agreement reached. Acceptance of Plea of Guilty for Ct 1 and Ct 2. Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty. Sentenced Ct 1 30 days county jail. Ct 2 4 months county jail. Imposed and Stayed. Sentences to run concurrently.  Presentence credit 12 days to be used in event of revocation. $443.00 fine for count 1 and count.  Total of $886.00 court cost. 18 months probation ordered. Conditions of AODA assessment. Maintain absolute sobriety. Take any/all medication(s) prescribed and only as prescribed.  Parenting class and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent. Seek and maintain gainful employment. DNA previously submitted. Appeal rights given. Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts by August 28, 2022, or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
